page.title: 03SEWAGE WORKS.
page.content: The area contains a large Sewage plant in its north west corner. The plant takes up a quarter of a mileclose to the confluence of the River Roach and the River Irwell. The plant is important in that it serves all Bury, Whitefield, Tottington, Heywood and Ramsbottom (when the Ramsbottom plant closes). Only eight people work at the plant, due to the fact that much of the work is automatic. At the present the plant is being extended near Blackford Bridge due to the closing of sewers at Ramsbottom and diversion of the water to Bury in 1986.
